passive.description: The user always has a Spirit counter on their screen. Spirits are collected over time and get used when you summon a buddy.

passive.name: Angel & Demon
passive.description: The user will always have 2 certain Buddies around them, the Angel (Shu) and Demon (Ra).

passive.name: Buddies
passive.description: Spirits can be used by the user by clicking on the ground which will randomly summon unique and random buddies. The "Heaven" zone buddies supports the player, and the "Hell" zone buddies offend enemies.

skills.name: Tap
skills.description: Summon buddies.

skills.name: Frostfire Grasp
skills.description: The user mounts on the Angel Buddy (Shu), and flies towards the position of their cursor. The user then summons an ice block that damages and stuns people.

skills.name: Wrath of Ra
skills.description: The user sends the Demon Buddy (Ra) to the position of the cursor (this move can be held to reach further). The Demon Buddy (Ra) then explodes into a pillar of fire, damaging enemies and launching 4 fiery balls into the air. This move has burn damage.

skills.name: Wrath of Shu
skills.description: The user mounts onto the Angel Buddy (Shu) and swiftly dashes to the cursor's location, then stomps on the Angel Buddy (Shu). This creates ice around the user as an AoE move. It also freezes enemies that get damaged by it.

skills.name: End of Times
skills.description: The user commands both Angel Buddy and Demon Buddy (Shu and Ra) to shoot a beam of ice and a beam of fire towards their cursor, stunning enemies. The two beams will then merge, creating a large AoE ice explosion.

skills.name: Sky Ruler
skills.description: The user mounts on one of the two Buddies, depending on if the user used Demon Buddy (Ra) or Angel Buddy (Shu) last, the Angel Buddy (Shu) is set by default.

mammoth.description: Have you ever imagined transforming into a creature of prehistoric might within the realms of Blox Fruits? The Mammoth Fruit, introduced in Update 20, offers a journey back in time, granting powers that resonate with the colossal beasts of the Ice Age. But how does this mythical transformation enhance your adventure?

passive.name: Prehistoric Jump
passive.description: When pressing the "Space" key while transformed, the user will create a small AOE shock wave that does no damage, however the landing creates a crater that deals damage.

passive.name: Mammoth Armor
passive.description: While transformed, the user gains a 60.5% damage reduction.

skills.name: Ancient Cutter
skills.description: The user turns into a mammoth covered in a dark aura, then stomps on the ground, sending three large slashes similar to Dragon's transformed X move through the ground and air. This move can be used in the air.

skills.name: True Prehistoric Punt
skills.description: The user turns into a mammoth covered in a dark aura, and dashes forward at a high speed. If a target is hit, they are launched upwards.

skills.name: Colossal Crusher
skills.description: The user dashes forward similar to the X move, but instead if a target is hit, they are slammed down.

skills.name: Transformation
skills.description: Transforms into an armored mammoth. (Armor provides approx. 60.5% damage reduction) The user will have different jump and dash animations, along with the ability to deal damage by falling to the ground when airborne.

skills.name: Stampede
skills.description: The user jumps forward, similar to Buddha C. The longer this move is held, the longer the user jumps, which is similar to Rubber's F move. Upon landing, the user creates a massive crater whilst damaging any enemy within said crater.

skillsV2.name: Tap
skillsV2.description: The user performs a 4 hit combo, utilizing 2 trunk slaps, a stomp with the front legs, and ending it with a furious roar. The Roar at the end is similar to Leopard's M1s.

skillsV2.name: Ancient Cutter
skillsV2.description: The user sends 3 large slashes similar to the untransformed version, followed by 3 more large slashes that are launched at a wider angle.

skillsV2.name: True Prehistoric Punt
skillsV2.description: The user dashes forward. If hit, the target will be knocked upwards, sending them high into the air, dealing high damage. This attack is way higher than Twin Hooks's X move.

skillsV2.name: Colossal Crusher
skillsV2.description: The user dashes forward. If hit, the target will be slammed into the ground with great force.

skillsV2.name: Transformation
skillsV2.description: The user reverts back to their human form.

skillsV2.name: Stampede
skillsV2.description: The user stampedes forward, dealing continuous damage for as long as the key is held. Provides immunity to stun. Disables instinct dodge.

dragon.description: In the vast and competitive realm of Blox Fruits, the Dragon Fruit emerges as a colossal force, boasting the largest transformation in the game and a suite of abilities that enhance both attack and defense.

passive.name: Fury Meter
passive.description: The user starts off with 50% of the "Fury Meter" bar when spawned. The user's Fury Meter needs to be full to be able to transform into a dragon. Fury is regained over time while not transformed and drains while transformed. Using moves while transformed decreases the user's Fury Meter.

passive.name: Transformation
passive.description: In Dragon form, the user gains a 62.5% damage resistance to all attacks.

skills.name: Heatwave Beam
skills.description: The user fires a beam of energy from their mouth, knocking enemies back.

skills.name: Dragonic Claw
skills.description: The user harnesses a ball of fire in their right hand, then dashes toward where the cursor is. Upon reaching an enemy, the user grabs them and drags them along, leaving a trail of fire behind. If used in the air, the user drags the enemy caught to the ground. The drag ends early upon colliding with a wall.

skills.name: Fire Shower
skills.description: The user jumps up into the air and begins shooting fireballs towards the ground. Upon impact, the projectiles explode, damaging enemies caught in the vicinity, knocking them back, and stunning them for a brief moment. Holding this move allows the user to shoot fireballs for around 2.5 seconds.

skills.name: Transformation
skills.description: If the user has a maxed Fury meter, the user transforms into a dragon. Consumes 15% of Fury upon transformation.

skills.name: Dragon Flight
skills.description: The user grows dragon wings and is now able to fly. (The user will fly faster when aiming upward)

skillsV2.name: Heatwave Beam
skillsV2.description: The user shoots a huge beam of fire from their mouth. Consumes approximately 7.5% of Fury.

skillsV2.name: Dragonic Claw
skillsV2.description: The user opens their mouth wide open then proceeds to shoot three crescent shaped projectiles in three directions from its claw, damaging and burning enemies it hits for a short time. Consumes 10% of Fury.

skillsV2.name: Fire Shower
skillsV2.description: A ball of raging flames forms within the user's mouth, and is then unleashed. Upon hitting anything, this ball explodes and burns anything it comes unto contact with. Consumes 15% of Fury.

skillsV2.name: Transformation
skillsV2.description: The user reverts back to their human form.

leopard.description: Discovering the potential of the Leopard in Blox Fruits can be a fascinating experience. This exotic Beast, released in Update 17 Part 3, has captured the imagination of players with its impressive design and powerful abilities.

passive.name: Half-Leopard, Half-Human
passive.description: The wielder of this fruit is able to transform into a Leopard-Human hybrid. This form will disable their sword, gun and fighting style moveset. However, it allows them to gain unbelievable strength and allows them to have the ability to melee attack. The M1 consists of two immense punches, one swift kick, and one furious roar which breaks Instinct and deals AoE damage.

passive.name: Jump Boost
passive.description: While transformed, the user gains a jump boost, making them jumps slightly higher.

passive.name: Lava Immunity
passive.description: When transformed, the user is "immune" to all environment lava puddles, such as those found in Raids or on the island Hot and Cold. however, you are not immune at all to the lava, when you touch the lava with your body center it will cause damage. Note that this does not provide resistance to the moves of the Magma fruit.

skills.name: Finger Revolver
skills.description: Shoots out a blazing projectile out of the user's hand (supposedly their finger) where their cursor is aiming, which explodes into a fireball. If the key is held, it will send a barrage of normal projectiles first, then after a short moment the blazing projectile will be fired. If damage is taken while the move is held, the final projectile will be fired early.

skills.name: Spiraling Kick
skills.description: Sends out a thin saw-like blade that will hit your opponent several times, then shoots them upward in an updraft. The updraft remains there after the move is finished, and walking in the path of it with Instinct disabled or holding a move will cause you to be blasted up. This move is great for combos.

skills.name: Afterimage Assault
skills.description: The user teleports a couple times in their cursors direction then lets out a roar that deals damage and knock back. If you are on the ground then you smash the ground instead, breaks Instinct in the process.

skills.name: Transformation
skills.description: You transform into a Leopard-Human hybrid. While you won't be able to use your sword, gun and fighting style in this form, you'll gain a large speed and fruit moveset cooldown buff with a 10% damage reduction. This form has an melee attack that stuns and has an AoE roar attack every 4th click/tap. Using the C skill can increase your speed even further, and all moves deal slightly increased damage. After transforming, you let out a roar which does some damage and breaks Instinct.

skills.name: Body Flicker
skills.description: You move forward a short distance very fast (like a mini flash step.) and if there is a target in front of you knock them back with a swift kick and deal a good amount of damage, breaks Instinct.

skillsV2.name: Tap
skillsV2.description: User swings and hits with the claws. It has a combo for prolonged strikes.

Shoots out a blazing projectile out of the user's hand (supposedly their finger) where their cursor is aiming. After a while this projectile explodes. If the key is held down, it will send a barrage of normal projectiles where your cursor is aiming, then after a short moment the blazing projectile will be fired. If you take damage while holding this move, you will automatically shoot the final projectile, similar to other held moves.

Using your flexible legs, you are able to produce a slice of wind with your leg. If this ability hits, it will send out a thin, saw-like blade hitting your opponent multiple times, then shoots them upward in an updraft. The updraft remains there after the move is finished, and walking in the path of it with Instinct disabled or holding a move will result in you being caught in the updraft. This move is great for combos.

The user teleports towards the location of the user's cursor, then lets out a furious roar. If this move is used on the ground, the user also smashes the ground with a great slam when this move is used. This move breaks Instinct then adds a fire effect (cosmetic) to the user also increases speed by 40% for 3-4 seconds.

The user transforms back into their human form instantly, sending out a shower of particles. This reverts the user into their normal state, removing their ability to use Leopard's transformed moves, but in turn restores their ability to use Fighting Styles, Swords and Guns.

The user teleports forward a short distance in the blink of an eye (Sort of like a mini flash-step.) Anyone hit by this move will be hit with a swift kick which deals good damage and high knockback. This move is faster than it's untransformed counterpart. This move breaks Instinct.

kitsune.description: In Blox Fruits’ dynamic and ever-evolving universe, the Kitsune Fruit emerges as a game-changer with its unique mythical beast powers. Promising unprecedented abilities and strategic gameplay, the Kitsune Fruit has quickly garnered attention among the players.
